summary: Signature Bank is being investigated by New York regulators, with a focus on loans that may have violated laws intended to prevent predatory behavior.

summary: Artificial intelligence is making it possible for Street Views to be mined for insights about the economy, politics and human behavior — just as text mining has done for years.

summary: The disagreement between the internet service and Germany’s main music rights organization had restricted access to music videos on YouTube since 2009.

summary: Amazon and other tech giants have made devices connected to the internet increasingly prevalent. Now is the time to be freaking out about the dangers.

summary: Sergio Marchionne, chief executive of Fiat Chrysler, has an ambitious plan to save the auto industry. And he can’t seem to sell it.

summary: You know there’s a boom under way in Silicon Valley when it gets even tougher to hire top engineers and other personnel.

title: Chromebooks Gaining on iPads in School Sector
summary: Last year, about 3.9 million Chromebooks were shipped in the education sector, an increase in unit sales of more than 310 percent compared with the previous year, IDC said.

title: Facebook Says Trump’s Ban Will Last at Least 2 Years
summary: The decision denies the former president a megaphone at least through the midterm elections. The suspension was put in place after the Capitol riot in January.

title: Facebook Faces Two Antitrust Inquiries in Europe
summary: European Union and British regulators are investigating whether Facebook’s “vast troves of data” give Facebook Marketplace an unfair advantage.

title: A Dearth of I.P.O.s, but It’s Not the Fault of Red Tape
summary: The number of companies on the U.S. stock market plummeted by half over 10 years, but there is not much evidence that regulation is the villain.

title: Digital Data Gives Billboard Owners More Reason to ‘Love a Good Traffic Jam’
summary: The average one-way trip for commuters in the U.S. is close to a half-hour — plenty of time for marketers to target them in new ways through old media.

title: Wing, Owned by Google’s Parent Company, Gets First Approval for Drone Deliveries in U.S.
summary: The company’s effort, approved by the Federal Aviation Administration, will be limited to parts of southwest Virginia.

summary: Two Times media reporters analyze why 2017, despite powerful foes like Netflix and the fallout of harassment scandals, was the year TV roared back.

summary: A meeting in May was meant for a discussion of foreign meddling in this year’s midterm elections. But some tech officials left frustrated.

title: Lyft’s First Results After I.P.O. Show $1.14 Billion Quarterly Loss
summary: The ride-hailing company’s revenue nearly doubled for the quarter, while its loss was driven by a hefty charge for its stock-based compensation plan.

title: Stock Markets Slip on Trade Policy Fears
summary: Tech shares were especially hard hit on concerns that the Trump administration would restrict Chinese investment in American technology firms.

title: Troubleshooting Android in Safe Mode
summary: Third-party apps and recent operating system updates are often the cause; starting the phone in Safe Mode can help narrow down the search for a culprit.

summary: A number of small companies are looking for ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. But investors, burned by the clean-tech boom a decade ago, are leery.

summary: Signature Bank is being investigated by New York regulators, with a focus on loans that may have violated laws intended to prevent predatory behavior.

summary: Artificial intelligence is making it possible for Street Views to be mined for insights about the economy, politics and human behavior — just as text mining has done for years.

summary: The disagreement between the internet service and Germany’s main music rights organization had restricted access to music videos on YouTube since 2009.

summary: Amazon and other tech giants have made devices connected to the internet increasingly prevalent. Now is the time to be freaking out about the dangers.

title: Slack Restores Service After Starting 2021 With Outage
summary: The company apologized for the disruptions, which lasted for a few hours as users returned to work after the holidays.

title: F.C.C., in Potential Sign of the Future, Halts New Data Security Rules
summary: The F.C.C. delayed data security rules requiring internet providers like AT&T and Comcast secure their customers’ data against hacking.

title: The Tools for Covering Tech Are the Same as in 2009
summary: John Herrman, who writes about the internet, is using many of the same tech tools as a decade ago — but the conversation around how we use them has changed.

title: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: President Trump’s Unsecured Phone and His C.E.O. Confidant
summary: Social media tries to tamp down fake news sites, the president isn’t giving up his unsecured phone and Elon Musk is trying to be a voice of reason.

title: TikTok Bid Highlights Oracle’s Public Embrace of Trump
summary: The tech giant stands out in Silicon Valley for its close ties to the administration, which must bless any deal for the social media app.

title: Europe’s Case Against Google Might Help Rivals More Than Consumers
summary: The driving force pushing the recent European action against Google’s search engine was a consortium of corporate rivals.

title: Vox Media Acquires New York Magazine, Chronicler of the Highbrow and Lowbrow
summary: After more than 50 years and 44 National Magazine Awards, New York finds a home with a digital-media powerhouse.

title: A Canadian ‘Buy Local’ Effort Fights Amazon on Its Own Turf
summary: A website called Not Amazon was created to drive sales to more than 4,000 independent stores in four cities. The initiative aims to keep expanding.

title: Google, Facebook and Others Broaden Group to Secure U.S. Election
summary: More tech companies met with government agencies on Wednesday to fight disinformation on social media.

title: Starbucks, Exxon, Apple: Companies Challenging (or Silent on) Trump’s Immigration Ban
summary: The reaction from major American companies to President Trump’s order has ranged from silence to outrage.

title: DealBook Briefing: Carlyle’s Founders Give Outsiders More Power
summary: The investment giant announced that it is becoming a C corporation and moving to a “one share, one-vote” model that could give its stock price a boost.

title: YouTube Unveils Subscription Television Service
summary: The site says people watch more than a billion hours a day on it. It will join other companies offering content to viewers trying to cut the cord.

title: As Facebook Sweeps Across Europe, Regulators Gird for Battle
summary: The European Court of Justice is expected to issue a preliminary decision over whether the social network giant can continue transferring data between Europe and the United States.

title: It’s Her Job to Get More People to Act Like You Right Now
summary: Millie Tran, the first global growth editor at The Times, discusses how she tries to understand and nurture a worldwide audience. “So many dashboards and data sets!”

title: Google Will Further Block Some European Search Results
summary: To fend off privacy complaints, the search giant will block access to certain links from all of its search sites when used from the European Union.

title: Amazon Posts an Unexpected Profit, and Its Shares Soar
summary: The company reported net income of 17 cents a share, rather than the 13-cent loss analysts expected. Its shares rose as much as 10 percent after-hours.

summary: Google has a new way to safeguard your online accounts. Here’s how the program works, and why it may (or may not) be a better security choice for you.

summary: Newer versions of Google’s browser include a setting to easily mute web pages that would otherwise open with audio blaring.

summary: In a sweeping proposal to be revealed on Tuesday, Ajit Pai, the chairman of the F.C.C., is preparing to scrap the net neutrality rules, said people familiar with the plan.

summary: Microsoft, JPMorgan Chase and other corporate giants are joining forces to create a computing system based on a virtual currency network, Ethereum.

summary: His campaign is testing the boundaries of what platforms like Twitter and Facebook allow in politics. They’re having trouble coming up with an answer.

summary: In Silicon Valley, momentum means everything, the Deal Professor writes. Twitter appears to have little, while Snap, formerly Snapchat, has plenty, but faces risks of its own.

summary: Mr. Epstein, the accused sex trafficker, was fascinated by eugenics. He told scientists and others of his vision of using his New Mexico ranch to impregnate women.

summary: The president of Carnegie Mellon University, which will establish the center, said injecting ethical discussions into A.I. is necessary as the technology advances.

summary: Two generations of Silicon Valley giants are finding that working together is better than falling behind competitors like Amazon and Microsoft.

summary: The value of the digital currency jumped this afternoon after Mr. Thiel’s Founders Fund venture firm emerged as an investor.

summary: From New Hampshire to Scotland, services like Google Maps can direct ill-prepared hikers onto trails that would challenge even the most experienced climbers, mountaineers said.

summary: For you and me, the repeal of net neutrality rules can be boiled down to two questions: What might happen? And who do you trust?

title: The Government’s Consumer Data Watchdog
summary: The Federal Trade Commission’s chief technologist fights to ensure that companies keep consumers’ information safe and private.

title: AOL in Deal With Microsoft to Take Over Display Ad Business
summary: AOL will take over management and sales of display, mobile and video advertising that appears on Xbox, Skype and other Microsoft products in several countries.

title: Chromebooks Gaining on iPads in School Sector
summary: Last year, about 3.9 million Chromebooks were shipped in the education sector, an increase in unit sales of more than 310 percent compared with the previous year, IDC said.

title: Facebook Says Trump’s Ban Will Last at Least 2 Years
summary: The decision denies the former president a megaphone at least through the midterm elections. The suspension was put in place after the Capitol riot in January.

title: Facebook Faces Two Antitrust Inquiries in Europe
summary: European Union and British regulators are investigating whether Facebook’s “vast troves of data” give Facebook Marketplace an unfair advantage.

title: A Dearth of I.P.O.s, but It’s Not the Fault of Red Tape
summary: The number of companies on the U.S. stock market plummeted by half over 10 years, but there is not much evidence that regulation is the villain.

title: Digital Data Gives Billboard Owners More Reason to ‘Love a Good Traffic Jam’
summary: The average one-way trip for commuters in the U.S. is close to a half-hour — plenty of time for marketers to target them in new ways through old media.

title: Wing, Owned by Google’s Parent Company, Gets First Approval for Drone Deliveries in U.S.
summary: The company’s effort, approved by the Federal Aviation Administration, will be limited to parts of southwest Virginia.

title: From Trump to #MeToo: A Dizzying Year in TV News
summary: Two Times media reporters analyze why 2017, despite powerful foes like Netflix and the fallout of harassment scandals, was the year TV roared back.

title: Top Tech Companies Met With Intelligence Officials to Discuss Midterms
summary: A meeting in May was meant for a discussion of foreign meddling in this year’s midterm elections. But some tech officials left frustrated.

title: Lyft’s First Results After I.P.O. Show $1.14 Billion Quarterly Loss
summary: The ride-hailing company’s revenue nearly doubled for the quarter, while its loss was driven by a hefty charge for its stock-based compensation plan.

title: Stock Markets Slip on Trade Policy Fears
summary: Tech shares were especially hard hit on concerns that the Trump administration would restrict Chinese investment in American technology firms.

title: Troubleshooting Android in Safe Mode
summary: Third-party apps and recent operating system updates are often the cause; starting the phone in Safe Mode can help narrow down the search for a culprit.

title: Start-Ups Hoping to Fight Climate Change Struggle as Other Tech Firms Cash In
summary: A number of small companies are looking for ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. But investors, burned by the clean-tech boom a decade ago, are leery.

title: DealBook Briefing: A Favorite Trump Bank Questioned Over Kushner Credit
summary: Signature Bank is being investigated by New York regulators, with a focus on loans that may have violated laws intended to prevent predatory behavior.

title: How Do You Vote? 50 Million Google Images Give a Clue
summary: Artificial intelligence is making it possible for Street Views to be mined for insights about the economy, politics and human behavior — just as text mining has done for years.

title: YouTube Agrees to Pay Royalties, Ending German Music Dispute
summary: The disagreement between the internet service and Germany’s main music rights organization had restricted access to music videos on YouTube since 2009.

summary: Amazon and other tech giants have made devices connected to the internet increasingly prevalent. Now is the time to be freaking out about the dangers.

summary: Sergio Marchionne, chief executive of Fiat Chrysler, has an ambitious plan to save the auto industry. And he can’t seem to sell it.

summary: Tim Herrera, editor of The New York Times’s Smarter Living section, does not believe the answer to happiness is less technology. Here’s why.

summary: The European Court of Justice is expected to issue a preliminary decision over whether the social network giant can continue transferring data between Europe and the United States.

summary: You know there’s a boom under way in Silicon Valley when it gets even tougher to hire top engineers and other personnel.

summary: The company apologized for the disruptions, which lasted for a few hours as users returned to work after the holidays.

summary: The F.C.C. delayed data security rules requiring internet providers like AT&T and Comcast secure their customers’ data against hacking.

summary: The tech giant stands out in Silicon Valley for its close ties to the administration, which must bless any deal for the social media app.

summary: The driving force pushing the recent European action against Google’s search engine was a consortium of corporate rivals.

summary: To fend off privacy complaints, the search giant will block access to certain links from all of its search sites when used from the European Union.

summary: In Silicon Valley, momentum means everything, the Deal Professor writes. Twitter appears to have little, while Snap, formerly Snapchat, has plenty, but faces risks of its own.

summary: Mr. Epstein, the accused sex trafficker, was fascinated by eugenics. He told scientists and others of his vision of using his New Mexico ranch to impregnate women.

title: Lyft’s First Results After I.P.O. Show $1.14 Billion Quarterly Loss
summary: The ride-hailing company’s revenue nearly doubled for the quarter, while its loss was driven by a hefty charge for its stock-based compensation plan.

title: Stock Markets Slip on Trade Policy Fears
summary: Tech shares were especially hard hit on concerns that the Trump administration would restrict Chinese investment in American technology firms.

title: Troubleshooting Android in Safe Mode
summary: Third-party apps and recent operating system updates are often the cause; starting the phone in Safe Mode can help narrow down the search for a culprit.

summary: A number of small companies are looking for ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. But investors, burned by the clean-tech boom a decade ago, are leery.

summary: Signature Bank is being investigated by New York regulators, with a focus on loans that may have violated laws intended to prevent predatory behavior.

summary: Artificial intelligence is making it possible for Street Views to be mined for insights about the economy, politics and human behavior — just as text mining has done for years.

title: YouTube Agrees to Pay Royalties, Ending German Music Dispute
summary: The disagreement between the internet service and Germany’s main music rights organization had restricted access to music videos on YouTube since 2009.

summary: Amazon and other tech giants have made devices connected to the internet increasingly prevalent. Now is the time to be freaking out about the dangers.

summary: Sergio Marchionne, chief executive of Fiat Chrysler, has an ambitious plan to save the auto industry. And he can’t seem to sell it.

summary: You know there’s a boom under way in Silicon Valley when it gets even tougher to hire top engineers and other personnel.

summary: The company apologized for the disruptions, which lasted for a few hours as users returned to work after the holidays.

summary: You know there’s a boom under way in Silicon Valley when it gets even tougher to hire top engineers and other personnel.

summary: The F.C.C. delayed data security rules requiring internet providers like AT&T and Comcast secure their customers’ data against hacking.

summary: John Herrman, who writes about the internet, is using many of the same tech tools as a decade ago — but the conversation around how we use them has changed.

summary: The driving force pushing the recent European action against Google’s search engine was a consortium of corporate rivals.
